main event: Multiple sightings of unidentified flying objects (UFOs) were reported near Kirtland AFB, New Mexico in November 1953.
interesting points: The UFOs were observed visually and detected on radar, with some reports describing bright flashes of light.
The UFOs were described as round, yellowish-white objects, sometimes appearing like falling stars.
The sightings occurred over the course of several days, with one report describing an object that slowed down, hovered, then split into two bright reddish lights before disappearing.
Weather conditions during the sightings were generally clear with little wind.
The reports were submitted by military personnel, including pilots and intelligence officers, who assessed the objects as possibly being meteors or other natural phenomena.
sighted object: round, yellowish-white objects, bright flashes of light
witnesses: military personnel, including pilots and intelligence officers
